Prerequisites: PREREQUISITE: ACG 3101 WITH A GRADE OF "C" OR BETTER.
Course Description: IN-DEPTH STUDY OF FINANCIAL REPORTING CONCEPTS AND GENERALLY ACCEPTED PRACTICE FOR LONG-TERM LIABILITIES, LEASES, PENSIONS, INCOME TAXES, AND STOCKHOLDERS EQUITY AND EARNINGS PER SHARE. EMPHASIS ON ANALYZING FINANCIAL EVENTS AND THE CONSEQUENCES OF FINANCIAL REPORTING ALTERNATIVES.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
